maze.gui

Class InputHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • maze.gui.InputHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class InputHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Class that represents all "input handler" type objects. An input handler reads the keyCode variable from a "window" type object (and/or child objects) and saves that keyCode into an Array, reseting the "window" keyCode afterwards. Any kind of instance of this type is running in a separated thread, therefore it doens't "freeze" the main program while it waits for keyCode values.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Waits for a keyCode from the window's KeyListener to be different from 0. When it is, its saved to the array [commands].
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • getNextCommand

        public java.lang.Integer getNextCommand()
        Gets the first element of the array commands.
        Returns:
        First element of the queue. If the queue is empty, returns -1.
